content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) configured with burner‐inserters and output chests for processing raw ores.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) with a similar setup.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• A burner‐mining drill connected to a wooden chest and interlinked by transport belts to extract and collect iron ore.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• A laboratory receiving automation‐science‐pack inputs, supported by a network of small electric poles for power.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) with connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5) supplying water for power generation.
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5) providing the water input.
• Pre‐existing steam engines located at:
  – Position(x=1.5, y=13.5)
  – Position(x=13.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=19.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=13.5, y=17.5)
  – Position(x=17.5, y=20.5)
  – Position(x=11.5, y=20.5)
  – Position(x=22.5, y=18.5)
  – Position(x=4.5, y=23.5) [currently unconnected]
• Extra Steam Engine for Improved Integration (Under Troubleshooting)
  – Initially attempted at Position(x=8.5, y=17.5) but pipe connection procedures failed.
  – Repositioned to Position(x=14.5, y=17.5) with subsequent pipe connection errors.
  – Picked up and relocated to Position(x=1.5, y=10.5); later attempts to move it near the ideal target Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) were thwarted by interfering entities and exceeding placement range.
  – Current status: Integration of the extra steam engine with the Boiler via pipes remains unresolved.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Pipe Connection Issues
 – When connecting pipes between the Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) and a steam engine, verify that both entities’ connection points are aligned and free of obstructions.
 – Ensure an adequate supply of pipes is on hand and that the planned connection area is clear before initiating the connection.

• Placement and Repositioning Errors
 – Confirm that the target area for placing a steam engine is unoccupied and that the terrain permits placement (avoid water or other unplaceable obstacles).
 – Always move the player within the allowed placement distance (within the maximum range) to prevent distance‐related errors.
 – When removing interfering entities, supply arguments in the required format to avoid type mismatches (for example, do not call a Position object as a function).

• Buildable Area Search Failures
 – If encountering errors such as “'Position' object is not callable” while searching for a buildable area, review how Position objects are handled. Do not invoke them as functions; use their data attributes directly instead.

Please verify that all structures and connections are configured as intended in the power network.
